result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marques R Lee

records.addlTxt:
Reporter: Pat Burnard
 Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty. Court accepted def's plea but w/h adjudication and referred def to Community Restorative Court. Bail continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
To be set for plea & sentencing
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Status conference on March 25, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Information was e-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defn waived reading of Information; Counsel enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of Defendant; motions due within 20 days; bail continued.

01:48 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Amy M Johnson.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.
Preliminary hearing on February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process within 10 days of today. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 7 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

10:59 AM Defendant appeared.  Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
